title: bifurcated driver
extract: Queue Splitting (Bifurcated Driver) is a design that allows for directing some traffic to DPDK, while keeping the remaining traffic in the traditional Linux networking stack. The filtering (splitting) is done in the hardware Network Interface Card (NIC).Oct 2, 2015
extract_html: Queue Splitting (Bifurcated Driver) is a design that allows for directing some traffic to DPDK, while keeping the remaining traffic in the traditional Linux networking stack. The filtering (splitting) is done in the hardware Network Interface Card (NIC).Oct 2, 2015
